Description: Book of the Dead of Tui; frame 5; coloured vignettes; retrograde hieratic page numbers.
Curator's comments: The fragments are not in order; other parts of this papyrus are in Bologna, Museo Civico, KS 3168, from the Palagi collection (ex-Nizzoli?). Joins directly to P. Moscow I, 1b, 122 (Irmtraut Munro). Part of same papyrus, EA 79431.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (133546) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/133546)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.95-104)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached, fractured, loss Black ink Pigment Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fragmentary, very white papyrus
Associated names: Associated with: Tui (named in Bologna fragments only)
Representation of: Horakhty (the label Ax.tj appears in front of him)
Acquisition notes: Part of Lot Number 118 in the 1835 Salt Sale.
